title: Currency Structuring Pattern Detected
description: Multiple cash deposits on consecutive days (January 18-20, 2024) totaling $29,994, each just below the $10,000 Currency Transaction Report threshold. Deposits of $9,999, $9,998, and $9,997 on three consecutive days strongly suggest intentional structuring under 31 U.S.C. ยง 5324.
counter_hypothesis: Coincidental business receipts from cash-heavy operations
recommended_actions: Review CCTV footage from deposit dates
legal_citations: 31 U.S.C. ยง 5324 - Structuring transactions to evade reporting

title: Ghost Employee Payments
description: Payroll records show bi-weekly payments to 'Ghost Employee' (ID: E010) in Operations department totaling $18,000 over the investigation period (4 pay periods ร $4,500). No corresponding HR records, badge access logs, email activity, or supervisor verification found.
counter_hypothesis: Legitimate remote employee with separate system access

title: Concentrated Vendor Payments - ABC Corp
description: ABC Corp received $46,000 (35% of total disbursements) across 6 transactions during the investigation period. Multiple invoices lack detailed descriptions, and vendor shows signs of being related party. Pattern consistent with kickback arrangement or fictitious vendor scheme.
recommended_actions: Request ABC Corp due diligence package
Review contract and scope of work

title: Round Dollar Journal Entry Concentration
description: 68% of journal entries (20 of 30) are round dollar amounts. Expected frequency for legitimate transactions is approximately 5%. High concentration suggests manual manipulation, estimation, or fraudulent entries rather than actual recorded transactions.
counter_hypothesis: Business practices use rounded amounts for simplicity
recommended_actions: Test sample of round entries to source documents

title: Weekend/Holiday Transaction Activity
description: Three transactions were recorded on dates when the office was closed (weekends). This could indicate backdating, unauthorized access, or automated system misconfigurations.
counter_hypothesis: Authorized remote work or automated processes
recommended_actions: Review access logs for weekend dates
